metadata.name: Is this role being posted for the immigration team?

title: AD, Healthcare Analytics
content:
Our Opportunity:
Chewy is looking for an Associate Director of Healthcare Retail Analytics to join our Healthcare Analytics Team. In this role, you will lead a team of analytics personnel in delivering high quality insights, driving recommendations, and developing data tools. You will partner directly with Healthcare senior leaders to meet the analytics needs of Category Management along with other cross-functional stakeholders and deliver both tools and analyses that improve assortment, customer experience, and financial metrics.
The ideal candidate has proven experience leading analytics teams, building data tools and processes that scale, along with superior analytical, technical, and financial acumen. The ideal candidate excels at both Thinking Big and Operating at Depth, demonstrating exemplary skills analyzing large data sets, partnering with business stakeholders to drive prioritization, and turning analyses into action. This individual is highly proficient in developing talent and leading cross-functional programs while being able to operate with minimal direction from leadership. Strong written and verbal communication skills are required as this role will lead teams, interface directly with executive leadership, and own prioritization of analytics needs across multiple teams.
What you'll do:

Partner directly with Healthcare senior leadership to prioritize and deliver Retail analytics initiatives across multiple functional groups and stakeholders  
Proactively anticipate the analytics needs of Category Management and Product owners to build tools and solutions which data retrieval, insights generation, and self-serve analytics
Lead development of best-in-class measurement frameworks for evaluating assortment, promotion and discount effectiveness, and customer behavior across all dimensions of Chewy’s business
Proactively generate analysis ideas, measure and analyze business trends, and deliver actionable insights and recommendations in research style documents to broad stakeholder groups
Lead recurring business reviews to share team progress, wins, and opportunities
Mentor, coach, and develop analytics team members
Provide hands-on guidance to multiple analytics team members in developing reports, managing data processes, and delivering analyses across multiple retail verticals
Program manage cross-functional initiatives related to change management, ensuring necessary updates are made to impacted data products
Partner with Technology and Product teams to assess downstream impact of process or feature changes
Lead analytics and data engineering teams to prioritize and QA development of new data tables, metrics, and products 

What you'll need:

Minimum of Bachelor’s degree in Analytics related discipline such as Finance, Economics, Math, Statistics or a related degree with analytics and quantitative emphasis; MBA or Masters in Analytics preferred 
Minimum 8 years delivering business insights and analytics tools in an ecommerce or retail setting
Strong leadership skills with minimum of 5 years managing people
Strong understanding of Ecommerce and retail strategies across pricing, assortment, fulfillment, and inventory management
Exemplary stakeholder management and prioritization skills using systems, processes, and scalable frameworks
Proven experience delivering large scale analytics initiatives on tight timelines
Exemplary written and verbal communication skills using data to recommend and drive actions
Advanced Excel skills (data connections, complex formulas, pivot tables; VBA preferred) 
Strong data visualization skills using software such as Tableau or complementary visualization tools
Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with cloud-based data storage and extraction processes
Thorough understanding of Financial KPIs and P&L statement
High degree of proficiency creating and interpreting business metrics, executing complex analyses, and connecting multiple data sources to explain business performance
Superior attention to detail and experience building processes to validate data integrity
Proven experience leading teams and delivering results in ambiguous and resource constrained environments  
Passion for data and an obsession to use data to drive value for customers and business
Ability to travel up to 10% of the time

Bonus:

MBA, Masters in Analytics, or equivalent advanced academic degree
Project Management Certification
Advanced technical skills using R, Python, or other programming languages
Data modeling experience in Merchandising, Finance, Retail/Ecommerce
Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.
 
If you have a question regarding your application, please contact HR@chewy.com.
 
To access Chewy's Customer Privacy Policy, please click here. To access Chewy's California CPRA Job Applicant Privacy Policy, please click here.

questions.label: Internal purposes only - no need to answer *
Arbitration Agreement Signed?
Arbitration Agreement Signed Date

Deloitte is Chewy’s independent auditor. To not impair Deloitte's independence, Chewy must validate the role of any current or former Deloitte employee against any exempt role they are interviewing for at Chewy. Do you currently work for Deloitte or have you ever been employed by Deloitte in the past?

Close family ties to a Deloitte employee could also impair Deloitte’s independence as Chewy’s auditor should you become employed by Chewy.  Do you have a close family member (spouse or equivalent, parent, dependent, non-dependent child, and/or sibling) that currently works for Deloitte?
